intro: Dryadella gomes-ferreirae, commonly known as the São Tomé ironwood, is a rare and endemic tree species native to the island of São Tomé. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, leathery leaves. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforest areas. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant ecological and botanical interest.
